sys_hub_flow.description: (Multiple API calls.) Checks all MAC addresses against Armis to see if there's a matching computer. If there is, creates an association and pulls the data. If there isn't, no action is taken.

sys_hub_flow.name: LINK_EvaluateDeviceMACs

sys_hub_action_instance.comment: Next check all of the network adapters associated with the computer. If any of them match an Armis record, handle and end.

sys_hub_flow_logic.comment: First check whether a valid MAC exists in the computer table itself. If it does, try to find it--if an Armis record exists, handle it and end.

sys_hub_flow_input.label: computer
sys_hub_flow_input.name: var__m_sys_hub_flow_input_92716effdbf89450cb24431e1396199f

sys_hub_action_instance.comment: Next check all of the network adapters associated with the computer. If any of them match an Armis record, handle and end.

sys_hub_flow_logic.comment: First check whether a valid MAC exists in the computer table itself. If it does, try to find it--if an Armis record exists, handle it and end.

sys_hub_flow_snapshot.description: (Multiple API calls.) Checks all MAC addresses against Armis to see if there's a matching computer. If there is, creates an association and pulls the data. If there isn't, no action is taken.

sys_hub_flow_snapshot.name: LINK_EvaluateDeviceMACs

sys_hub_flow_logic.comment: First check whether a valid MAC exists in the computer table itself. If it does, try to find it--if an Armis record exists, handle it and end.

sys_hub_action_instance.comment: Next check all of the network adapters associated with the computer. If any of them match an Armis record, handle and end.
